intro: Tarenna rudis, commonly known as the red-veined tarenna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with prominent red veins, giving it its common name. It produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Tarenna rudis is often found in moist, shaded forest environments, where it thrives in the understory.
